page.title: 11The Harbour, Fraserburgh
page.content: {Fraserburgh Harbour}is divided into eight basins and harbours. The entrance to the harbour faces south-east into Fraserburgh Bay and leads into the{Outer Harbour}beside the northern breakwater. Some of the remaining basins have names;{Winter {Dock, Balaclava Harbour, North {Harbour,}and{Faithlie Harbour. The port has a large number of locally owned and registered{fishing {vessels}and these are supported by a {slipway, fishmarket, ice plant, boat- {builders yards, engineering workshops and{fish processing factories. In addition to fishing activities in the harbour there is also a reasonable amount of{commercial shipping traffic trading to the continent and further afield. The port also occasionally sees a small amount of{oil-related {traffic.
